definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to benefit from each other's strengths and make up each other's shortfalls/to reciprocate with material assistance/scratch each other's back

sentences.english: Business people from all over the world meet in Guangzhou at this event, exchanging business information and developing friendships.
sentences.chinese: 來自世界各地的客商雲集廣州，互通商情，增進友誼。

sentences.english: They live in rooms which intercommunicate.
sentences.chinese: 他們住在互通的房間裏。

sentences.english: Logistics systems are a lot of stovepipes not talking to each other.
sentences.chinese: 後勤系統很多是煙囪式的，相互之間不能互通。

sentences.english: The key of resource sharing depends on internetworking, interconnecting and interoperation.
sentences.chinese: 其共享的關鍵在於實現資源間的互聯互通和互操作。

sentences.english: Moreover, with multi-channels interconnection, resources from provinces, cities and counties have been sharing.
sentences.chinese: 子平臺可分可合，多信道互聯互通，省市縣資源共享。

sentences.english: First, speed up the building of global Internet infrastructure and promote inter-connectivity.
sentences.chinese: 第一，加快全球網絡基礎設施建設，促進互聯互通。

sentences.english: How do you know about that? P: Feng-Shui is becoming quite popular in the West.
sentences.chinese: 風水在西方越來越流行，這也算是文化互通吧。

sentences.english: Further support for the towers comes from the connecting skybridges where tower residents will be able to congregate.
sentences.chinese: 進一步使各塔居民能互通的結構爲天空之橋。

sentences.english: Over time, the locations of these become known, and shared lore.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間流逝，這些地點會廣爲人知，並被互通有無。

sentences.english: Off-ramp and diverging area are important segments of interchange systems.
sentences.chinese: 出口匝道及分流區是互通式立體交叉的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Participation and communication are always appreciated.
Meanwhile, Clara and I were writing to each other.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，克拉拉和我在互通着書信。

sentences.english: Their members intermarry and combine beliefs and traditions.
sentences.chinese: 他們的成員互通婚姻，融合信仰與傳統。

sentences.english: Second, put in place the preliminary network of connectivity.
sentences.chinese: 初步建成互聯互通網絡。

sentences.english: It's important to realize interworking of two.
sentences.chinese: 實現二者的互通是當前要解決的一個迫切問題。

sentences.english: You will need to take further steps to test for interoperability.
sentences.chinese: 你需要進行一些步驟的互通性檢測。

definition: abbr. for 立體交叉|立体交叉[li4 ti3 jiao1 cha1] overpass
to link/to join/to attach/connection/a link (on web page)
to open access/to establish contact/to remove a block/to put through (a phone connection)
variant of 連接|连接[lian2 jie1]
multiple track (e.g. rail)/multi-lane (e.g. highway)/the complex line (math.)
to access (a network)/to insert (a plug) into (a socket)
